item.title: Focus
item.description: Focus As my projects demand me to become more technical and go into heads down build mode, I find that there is a paradigm shift that happens within me to help me focus and be productive. I enter into a “meditative like” state where I block everything out and just focus on the dev work/task ahead. Here are a few things that I do in particular to help me out with this:

item.title: Interact Application
item.description: So recently, I applied to a program that I had heard great things about called Interact. I had heard really good things about it from various people that I admired and decided to apply. The application process was actually super fun and I found the questions to be very incisive and authentic. This was one of the few applications that I actually enjoyed finishing and even if I get in or not, I’m grateful I applied!

item.title: Winter 2020
item.description: Why I took Winter 2020 off? -- Why I took Winter 2020 off? item.title: About
item.description: Hi there - I am Adi! I am currently a Computer Engineering student at the Universiy of Waterloo with a special affinity to Deep Learning, Data Science and Engineering. Three years ago, I chose to study Engineering to learn the skills I need to make products that impact lives of many people. A lot has changed since then; my reason for doing what I do though, has not. I aspire to leverage the skills that I have to develop projects that are exciting, ambitious, vertical, and impactful.
